timeline.message: CB-9209 Do not update instancemetadatas or stack status if flow is running for a stack

timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: it's strange we need this. I think StackStatusCheckerJob already checks
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: It can take long seconds to fetch provider side information. Meanwhile, flow can start in the background.
replies.author: sodre90

replies.bodyText: in that case it would make sense to throw an exception or similar to stop the whole sync. right now we will continue the sync just log an error.
replies.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: also I don't know if it's a good idea to have this check in a loop. freeipa won't have many instances but I would move these checks out from loops to ease the load on the database
replies.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText:
you are right:

I created a new exception (InterruptSyncingException)
check is moved before loops but after provider query operation
replies.author: sodre90

replies.bodyText:
thanks for the changes!
please consider catching InterruptSyncingException in executeInternal method instead of letting it propagate to quartz. There is a try-finally block already
replies.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: same here, code shouldn't reach this part if flow is running
timeline.author: lacikaaa
